<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Bard Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=677) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
<trait label="Multiclass" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=115" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 222 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Bard](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=3)

**Prerequisites**
Charisma 14

</column>

---

You cast spells like a bard and gain the Cast a Spell activity. You gain a spell repertoire with two common cantrips from the [occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) spell list or any other occult cantrips you learn or discover. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells. Your key spellcasting ability for bard archetype spells is Charisma, and they are occult bard spells. You become trained in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) and [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12); for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

 Choose a [muse](/classes/bard/muses) as you would if you were a bard. You have that muse for all purposes, allowing you to take that muse's feats, but you don't gain any of the other abilities it grants.

**Special** You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the bard archetype.

<title level="2">Bard Dedication leads to...</title>
[Basic Bard Spellcasting](/Feats.aspx?ID=678), [Basic Muse's Whispers](/Feats.aspx?ID=679), [Counter Perform](/Feats.aspx?ID=681), [Inspirational Performance](/Feats.aspx?ID=682)
name: Bard Dedication
